Reviews.Title: “good choice !”
Reviews.Author: florin adrian a
Reviews.Content: yes , Sultanahmet Park Hotel is a good choice . within walking distance from the well known historical sites in istanbul , easy to reach both by public transportation and/or by the van of the hotel , placed in a quiet neighborhood . and finally a piece of advice for the tourists : in order to avoid any disappointment - THE BEST PRICE IN ISTANBUL CAN ALWAYS BE BETTER . so do not be disappointed if you find later the same thing for less .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and cozy at a fair price!”
Reviews.Author: MarkoPasa
Reviews.Content: Although i only stayed for 2 days, i have nothing but the best to say about this hotel. The rooms are clean and tidy, bathrooms are always fresh, buffet breakfast is awesome, free internet. Location is also fine, only 5 minutes from ferry boat to Kadikoy, right next to Sultan Ahmet park. But, the best thing about this place is the hotel staff. They are very friendly, kind and helpful, charming and with great sense of humour. They made my stay there very fun and i'm so thankful for that! I will most certailny come there again. Marko RunjiÄ‡, Croatia

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: Jordan C
Reviews.Content: A great place. Would recommend it. Great views from the top floors.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs, so many better places nearby”
Reviews.Author: JHolst
Reviews.Content: Learn from my mistake. starting at the beginning: the transfer never arrived to pick us up at the airport, then when we arrived at the hotel for our double room there was a lot of commotion and waiting, until we were finally shown to a room with two beds pushed together, and barely a foot around the bed in every direction. (we booked the superior double, at ~140â‚¬ a night, not the budget rooms). aside from the tiny room and twin beds, the staff were friendly and breakfast ok. still the lift motor outside our room made noises all night, the room wasn't cleaned at all while we were there. the manager tried to convince us some people wanted twins when they booked doubles, joke. moved to a better hotel that was much cheaper after two nights, this place still tried to make us pay an extra night because we didn't give 24h notice. never again.

Reviews.Title: “I Like Sultanahmet Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hassan A
Reviews.Content: I Whont 2 say , I set in this hotel & I like to go there again, the staf is perfect & All is very good Mohd Hassan Al Hafez, Dubai

Reviews.Title: “My holiday”
Reviews.Author: Furkan A
Reviews.Content: it was a really good holiday, I've never experienced anything like this and it can be recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, good value”
Reviews.Author: WonndringKiwi
Reviews.Content: Title sums up our experience and impressions. Bonus was laundry nearby (sorry can't remember address but head down the hill and take 2nd road on left, go 50m or so and laundry is on your left).

Reviews.Title: “Just over rated”
Reviews.Author: Manu_Alvarez
Reviews.Content: I choose Sultanahmed Park Hotel after checking the good reviews at trip Advisor. After my visit there I just can say those reviews are just over rated and doesnâ€™t show an updated point of view of the hotel status. Rooms are extremely small and the views to the Blue mosque or Bosporus are only available from 4th floor. Of course rooms at 4th floor and upon are more expensive because of the views but are exactly the same size and condition as on any other floor below (except for the high elevator noise that is just a top floor extra). Shower on top levels doesnâ€™t have pressure enough nor hot water. This was my 3rth time at Istanbul but the first time that I choose Sultanahmed area to stay. I expected a better hotel according to the prices they are asking for the rooms. Please make a favor to yourself and choose any other hotel around.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Ian O
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 4 nights at the Sultanahmet Park hotel recently and had an excellent time there. The rooms though small are comfortable and the staff are helpful and friendly. It is situated less than 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Big disapointment”
Reviews.Author: silvia v
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel and we did not get the room we asked for. Rooms are really small (not enough space even to open the doors in the room and bathroom), there was no hot water everyday nor cleaned the room everyday, breakfas is poor, and if the elevator is broken (as it happened to us) you can not access or leave some of the rooms in the hotel.Views are only good in the last two floors of the hotel. The location is very good though to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “The best quality-price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry S
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul with my pregnant wife so hotel search and final choice was very difficult. From the start of e-mail communication till the end of trip manager Sinan was very polite, friendly and kind to us. He helped us in every question and situation. We had very comfortable and clean room with wonderful view. Inside double bed, two armchairs, table, cupboard, safe, nice bathroom, wi-fi. Standart breakfast in the morninig, very tasty tea all day:) The best quality-price ratio. Big thanks to hotel and its staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: shog a
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, nice people nice location close to everything, all historical site are within walking distances

Reviews.Title: “Holiday at Sultanahmet Park Hotel in March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Kawasaki386
Reviews.Content: I visited the Sultanahmet Park Hotel at date 9.-12.3.2012, so I think, I have very fresh experiences. The services are the best, because everything I needed and I asked for it,was in few minutes cleared. Especially I want to say very very BIG THANK YOU to mr.Sinan Erdogan!!! His friendly and nicely access was for me one of the best customer services, that I ever experienced. I can only recommend The Sultanahmet Park Hotel to everyone, who wants to experience an atmosphere "like at home", if is also far away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Small & clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Afshin74
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is great, next to touristic area and public transport (300m to tram station, and 1100m to cankurtaran train station) , although around streets and alleys are narrow and not luxury. Hotel is very small -with around 12 rooms- and rooms are so small which shocked you while arriving , but they're clean. at first we were at room No. 502, on backside with nice view of sultanahmet mosque but very small and has a noise problem from elevator which affect sleeping quality seriously ,by the way it's not clear for me why a wall closed stairs between fourth and fifth floors (maybe to be delete elevator's sound for below floors) , therefore we asked reception to changed our room and they give us room No. 201 which was silent and bigger room. room services is good although some holes available on bedsheet. Staff are very friendly. they give us a complementary breakfast when we arrive early at 9:00. and help us to take a taxi service to airport with reasonable price. Breakfast is very simple but acceptable. this hotel is very good choice for people which want to spend almost of their time outside. on the other hand is great for people that haven't credit cart -or don't want prepayment- you can reserve room via email or HRS site without prepayment. room fare is very good and it's most importance reason which cause high ranks for this hotel- beside friendly staff and cleanliness. At the end i thanks the polite and friendly staff of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to stay here:)”
Reviews.Author: Dmitriy S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Sultanahmed Park for 5 days and all this time we felt very comfortable in every way: staff (polite and helpful), room (small but comfortable), location (close to historical Istanbul center), price. It was my first time in Turkey and this hotel added good impressions to my image and memory about magic Istanbul! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Finest support”
Reviews.Author: Rheinhesse
Reviews.Content: Manager Sinan Erdogan was really of great help in booking various rooms for our group - Friendly and helpful with many ideas and suggestions: This service is great!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: YazME
Reviews.Content: The friendly and very helpful staff make all the difference at this hotel. They were always smiling and willing to offer any advice. The location is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: varoise75
Reviews.Content: Rather disappointed considering the wealth of positive to very positive comments... I must be too demanding or maybe I have stayed in better places for about the same price! Pros: - very good location (within 5 mins walk of the old city centre) - not too noisy if you get a room at the back - friendly staff on the whole Cons: -the breakfast is very average and the minute there are a few people having breakfast at the same time, staff do not seem to cope too well; plus if there was a shortage of something, it was not replaced -the room was NOT cleaned every day (one only needed to take a look at the thick carpet to see it had not been vacuumed for instance); it seems the only thing that was done was that the bin was emptied and the towels were changed... To me, this is not on for a hotel which seems to have high standards!! -the room was small and we booked it in november 2011 (so more than 3 months before!), asking for a double bed and we got 2 twin beds put together... Not ideal! In all, although I enjoyed staying in Istanbul, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know as I believe (and hope!) that there are better hotels out there in the same area for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sultanahmet Park”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie S
Reviews.Content: I would heartily recommend it. I found this hotel online, and booked 2 nights "just in case". We ended up staying for 6 nights in total. Friendly staff, scrumptious breakfasts every morning, best location as we could walk to the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, etc. The train was just around the corner. Close to a laundromat, it had everything we wanted. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but comfortable. 5th or 6th floor obvious the best for the views.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Yumiko0807
Reviews.Content: great location, clean room, friendly staff, and nice breakfast! u can walk to almost every popular places in Istanbul from here. the room was nice and clean, and it was kept warm although we stayed in snowy season. the staff were kind and friendly. we enjoyed fun chatting with them. it was very nice that they surved us chai for free even after we checked out our room. comparing to many other hotels we stayed in Trukey, breakfast here was the best. and they gave us discount for four-night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Mursheda K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short break in Istanbul.. The hotel itself is well located, it is a very touristy location and there is an abundance of oher hotels with similar styles close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any short break it is both comfortable and well situated. The staff are friendly and always willing to help especially Ugur behind the bar who was an absolute star !! The hotel is clean and well looked after, during our stay there were minor works being carried out thoughout the hallway, which was a bit annoying etc. They provide a continental breakfast in the moring and offer tea free of charge all through out the day - nice touch The rooms are pleasantly decorated, quite small with an en-suite and they have a free wi-fi available.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Sultanahmet by far.”
Reviews.Author: Emil_Unzer
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Excellent location; - Very warm reception and attentive staff; - Room with a front view of Blue Mosque (for only 29 euros per night!); - Early breakfast kindly offered by the desk (since our departure was early in the morning at Ataturk Airport); - Shuttle price with discount to the airport (10 euros per person); - Staff (always very helpful with us) called a reliable taxi cab and even gave us handy tips on where to buy outlet brand clothes; - Comfortable beds, pillows and clean bathroom. Cons: - The only remark I make is the size of the room (12 square metres), which we were aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Best view”
Reviews.Author: Shahin A
Reviews.Content: I knew that this hotel has a good view for Sultanahmet and Ayasofya, but did not predict that it is not good but wonderful view. Moreover hotel owner and personnel is very polite and helpful. I go to Istanbul very frequently, but I definetily know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Great Managment”
Reviews.Author: lex Y
Reviews.Content: nice and cozy with great value and friendly and helpful staff we were at room No. 302 btwn 22nd - 26th of Jan it was a nice small room with great view there was a problem using hot water twice good breakfast try the olives witch was great owner was a gentleman and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: batinaLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel online based on the good reviews it had. We went for the economy basement double room. When we arrived however, we got an upgrade free of charge and were put in a top floor room with a lovely view! What a great surprise as we didn't even ask for it! The owner is a very friendly man who welcomed us with a nice cup of Turkish cai and recommended a few places worth visiting. Him and his staff also organised a pick up for us at the end of our stay which then took us straight back to the airport for a very reasonable price. Our room was quite small (the hotel itself is small with 5 floors and only two rooms on each floor; this is what gives it such a friendly vibe). It had everything we needed, clean towels every day, small fridge, hairdryer, safe etc. The only thing some people might find quite negative is the strong smell of cigarettes which was the first thing I noticed when I walked in the room. This was despite the non-smoking signs in there. As Turks are very passionate smokers though I'd imagine this is similar in other hotels, too. Breakfast was the same each morning, giving choices of varied food (again, not really different from other hotels). We left a small tip after every breakfast which I assume was expected but greatly appreciated. As for the location, the hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia as well as the Grand Bazar in the opposite direction. Tram station is also about 3 or 4 mins walk. All in all, lovely place, amazing value, would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place near everything”
Reviews.Author: Cori G
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul, wonderful city, and were looking for a hotel and we found this hotel by chance (we were looking for an other one which almost has the same name) and we made the good choice! It's a very good place, close to everything (Blue Mosque, tramway, grand bazar, everything...) Small, quite, clean and nice hotel, there are two bedrooms per floor, good breakfast from 7 to 10:30. The staff is very friendly, available and will help you if you need some advices. Thanks to the owner for his help! C and C from france and spain

Reviews.Title: “a good base for sightseeing in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: travellingsalesmen
Reviews.Content: Just returned to London after our stay at the Sultanahment Park Hotel. We booked this on the internet after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. I have visited Istanbul many times and this place is very typical of the bed and breakfast style Sultanahmet hotels. It is a small hotel, which means you do get a very personal and typically warm Turkish welcome. The location is fantastic, a very short walk to most of the main historic sites. The rooms are very small, and bathrooms smaller, it is not a boutique hotel where you want to spend time in the day within the hotel. However it was clean, has free wifi downstairs, and they have a small garden where you can sit outside and have breakfast. I had to do some work and the staff kept bringing me complimentary tea and coffee which I very much appreciated. We took the Blue Mosque view room and it was by far the best view I have had from a hotel in Istanbul. One thing they could do to improve is offer a complimentary airport pick up service.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, friendly staff plus free entertainment by 3 kittens!”
Reviews.Author: OzzietravellerDubai
Reviews.Content: The location is TOPS, close to everything! Very friendly, laid-back staff and management. There were only 2 rooms per floor, so it was nice and 'personal'. Rooftop views were superb. The staff could not have been more helpful. Breakfast could be more varied as the same was offered daily. Loved the breakfast area which opens to a lovely garden with 3 kittens playing and entertaining the guests! Overall, it was value for money. The rich history and diversity Istanbul offer, makes it one of the best cities we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, *great staff*, very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Melinda_Que_Linda
Reviews.Content: I was in town by myself for a weekend last month and arrived late night from London. The hotel arranged a pick up from the airport which was very welcome. Its just two minutes from the main square and attractions like the Hagia Sophia and The Blue Mosque. Halil the night manager was welcoming. The room was small but clean and well decorated. The shower room and toilet were very clean. Water pressure was excellent. There was a wall mounted flat screen tv with English channels and BBC/ CNN. There are enough electric outlets for a girl with straighteners, a laptop, camera and Ipod to charge! The stairs are slightly narrow and marble, I had a room on the first floor and went up and down quite gingerly at first. There is a Mosque near by and so expect an early morning wake up call if your room faces the street. In the morning, there was a lovely breakfast display - guests can pick and choose from a Mediterranean style buffet or cereals. I was provided with an excellent map, advice about were and when to visit, and help changing money. There was a really personal level of service. The hotel is small and intimate and has a lovely courtyard garden where you can eat meals or sit and chill. I had a brilliant time, and would highly reccommend getting a pleasure boat and doing a river tour of this wonderful city. I loved my stay and the hotel staff were really helpful, which I appreciated because I was on my own. The two managers are friendly and so feel free to ask any advice about attractions or where to buy replacement earphones for your Ipod! The wait staff are very cute, kinda shy, but so very helpful. So Ugur, Husseyin and Atilla- thanks for the smiles and the assistance. I'd stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, safe, convenient accomodation in the Sultanahmet District of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cynan L
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Sultanahmet Park Hotel. The Hotel is ideally placed to allow easy walking to the major attractions in the Sultanahmet district, including the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia (which I could see from my room), the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar. There are lots of great restaurants and food-stands nearby. Cumali and his staff are courteous, helpful and trustworthy. The rooms are clean and TV includes BBC and CNN for those who need an English news fix. I will return with my family and arrange to stay again at the SPH.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: drebaly
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Sultnahmet Park Hotel in Istanbul for week in October 2011. The staff was very nice, accomodating, and the rooms were well cleaned every day. The staff has connections with tour guides and restaurants so they can help you find your way around Istanbul and Turkey as whole. The staff was always disappointed when we missed their delicious breakfast, which they serve to guests for free every day before 10:00am (I always woke up too late). I strongly recommend the the Sultnahmet Park Hotel if you need to stay near Istanbul's old city tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff - Great Istanbul Trip”
Reviews.Author: vixster8427
Reviews.Content: My husband, cousin and I stayed at the Sultanahmet Park Hotel a few weeks ago and although it is not a large hotel, we found it to be in a great location in Sultanahmet within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace & the Grand Bazaar. When we arrived our rooms were upgraded, and they were quite small, but we were not planning on staying in our rooms much of the time so this was not a concern. We were offered Turkish coffee and tea, which was nice. My biggest issue is cleanliness and our room was very clean and tidy. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly, and on various occasions the owners son and his friends did their best to help me with as much as they could, from my luggage, to coffee, to finding a good restaurant. This is what made the hotel great, because it is a small hotel which makes it more personal since they know everyone who is staying there at the moment. It was a great deal for the price we paid as other hotels seemed to be very expensive and didn't appear to be any different considering this hotel is close to many of the main attractions of Istanbul. The only negative parts of our stay was the noise of the lobby since we were on the 1st floor, you could hear almost every conversation that was going on which made it hard to sleep at first but was not a serious problem. Also, there were not many choices for breakfast but it was nice to sit outside in the morning for coffee. Overall, we had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “A place from where you can enjoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RobertWolfgang
Reviews.Content: Situated in the midst of the historical city, with few minutes walking not only to major monuments but also to the tramway. Astonishingly this is possible in a quiet surrounding, so that sleep is just interrupted by the Muezzins. It is a pleasure to deal with the friendly, kind and highly motivated staff. The room is well worth its price, and the breakfast clearly beyond standard. In total, I can fully recommend a stay in this little hotel, and I give my thanks to TripAdvisor for guiding me to it. A small critic: some foreign TV (news) channels besides the notorious ones would be fine. Special recommendations: - when weather allows, try the roof top restaurant associated with Kelebek CafÃ©, at 5 min from the hotel; - for Hagia Sophia, better wait for the (early) afternoon

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Nanapu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. The staff are really friendly and helpful. When we had prolem with our previously stayed hotel, poem, Halil was really helpful and patient. Always trying his best to provide help. The manager is also friendly. Would recomment this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for location and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Robin G
Reviews.Content: A truly great place to stay.I have stayed in many hotels over numerous years and have rarely come across a more welcoming hotel.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and always willing to chat to you about anything.In addition, the free breakfast was excellent and the service faultless. Finally, the hotel is exceptional value for money as it is in the heart of the cities main attractions.I couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: comfortable than home. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: jeeves530003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for one night - and was upgraded to a great room (for free!). The differentiating factor that makes this a truly great place to stay is the staff - extremely friendly and helpful, and genuinely interested in helping me figure out my itinerary. I've stayed at a lot of small hotels in major tourist areas and the people here definitely stand out in their service.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: anetefedorovska
Reviews.Content: I was there for 5 nights in september 2011, hotel stuff was extremely friendly, I was welcome there during all my stay. It is very easy to find the hotel and it is well located. You just do not have to worry about transportation because you can arrive by foot from everywhere in historical city center. hotel was clean, safe, calm. It has a beautiful garden where you have a delicious breakfast and a nice terrace to take photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: King_of_HK
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful, service excellent. The room is small but adequate, but I understand hotel rooms in Istanbul are generally small. Breakfast was above average. We are too pleased with their helping out with our luggages by calling a bigger cab which costs only US$6 more. They go the extra miles to help you

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for best price”
Reviews.Author: ShahinAb_114
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are very polite and help in any need. Moreover, hotel location is perfect, near Sultanahmet, Beyazit, Kapalicarsi ....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lysanne L
Reviews.Content: Close to all main attractions but located on a quiet street. Staff is super friendly and always ready to help. Nice and clean rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Anastasia (Greece)”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia R
Reviews.Content: I" ve visit Istanbul a lot of times and I" ve stayed in several hotels.Park hotel is a very beatiful hotel in the centre of the city,but very quiet,as well!You can find theare very good prices and the peoples that work theare are very helpfull and frendly. Cumali-Kurban-Uguz-Halil......four persons with a permanent smile who make you feel like home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go to sleep and wake up with a view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia”
Reviews.Author: PavlosGRE
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view!!!! as long as you select the right room. Paying the extra amount is absolutely worth it. Rooms are small, a bit outdated, but clean. The staff always polite, ready to help you. We enjoyed the garden, a small oasis in the center of all important sites. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “great!!”
Reviews.Author: hongkeun k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my friend for 3 nights, we couldn't ask for more, excellent service, very comprehensive and helpful staff, very clean rooms, and the best of all the location of the hotel, everything u want and anything is very close to the hotel, blue mosque and aya Sofia is less than 5 minutes walking, Sultanahmet downtown ( where all the pubs and food ) less than 1 min and the train exactly 30 seconds by feet! Also, there is a discount store you can use near the hotel. Can't ask for more!! Thank you very much for the service, we'll be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place that we recommend”
Reviews.Author: Marc L
Reviews.Content: we spend there 4 days during our trip in Turkey. It is perfectly located we blue mosque and near all touristic places. Reception was so friendly and always available to help us and give advices around a good glass of turkish tea. Room was very clean and very confortable. we will for sure be back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: miti_v_2000
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Park Hotel it's a Excellent hotel. Service very good Location very close to all sights Charming staff and more than helpful. We felt at home in this hotel.The hotel is very clean and the food also very good. I will gladly return to this hotel because because everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Blue Mosque and the tram!”
Reviews.Author: FlyinRedhead
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Park Hotel is a lovely little hotel in a wonderful location of Istanbul. It's just a couple minutes walk through a nice area to the Blue Mosque or to the Sultanahmet tram stop. I had the excellent mix of being in a quiet area, but still very close to the places I wanted to go every day. Breakfast wasn't my favorite and the elevator is tiny enough to give me claustrophobia issues, but those are extremely minor issues. The staff was friendly and tried to be helpful whenever possible. I had wi-fi access in my room that was extremely helpful in planning for activities. I would happily stay here again on a return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: clem81
Reviews.Content: Nice clean small rooms which were in my opinion expensive for what you get when you compare with other places I've stayed but since Istanbul is generally an expensive city, I would assume other hotels are the same. The staff were friendly though. I might check out other places before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Good Landscape”
Reviews.Author: AbrahamAred
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week in this hotel.Ä°t have a good landscape .Their staffs are very kind and hotel is very cheap

Reviews.Title: “excellent and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: nadia87r
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week in this hotel with my mother and we really appreciated the staff. they were very kind and nice with us. we felt very comfortable in this hotel which is close to the main monument (easy to walk there ). the rooms are not so big but well decorated and clean. I recommended it to those who want to spend nice and calm moments far away from the bigs and noisy hotels !! Nadia

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend, will come back again”
Reviews.Author: MoryLondon
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend the hotel for many reasons - the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are spotless clean, the back garden is nice and welcoming and beautiful. Having breakfast in this hotel's garden is the best beginning of a day. And location of cause - the Hotel is just behind the corner from all the main attractions. Besides, the prices are very reasonable for this location and for this standard of service. Will definitely stay in Sultanahment Park Hotel every time when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “About Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoetaDinu
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, particularly if you are spending just a few days in Istanbul as most of the major attractions are within walking distance (including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. The staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast (by buffet)very good, the rooms are a bit small but very new and very good furnished, good free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotal”
Reviews.Author: praha13
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Park hotel is a great place to stay. Staff is so friendly and helpful, there's a good breakfast buffet, and the rooms are very clean. Only two problems - there can be street noise if you are on the front of the building. The street fronting the hotel is a busy one. Also the rooms are very small. If you have a lot of luggage or if you are large persons, squeezing all your bags and yourselves into the room can be a problem. But if you can - get an upper room on the backside because the view of the Blue Mosque is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fall asleep and wake up watching Santa Sofia and Blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: sastals
Reviews.Content: Room for 50â‚¬. (room 502 - Hagia Sophia's Room Double-). Sultanahmet Park Hotel was a great choice in our Istanbul trip. This small and smart hotel is located in the tourist neighbourhood of Sultanahmet. From there, you can walk to main places, of the old city, that one must see in Istanbul (no more than 10 min). Furthermore, it is located near the Sultanahmet tram station, so you can move to other parts of the city or to the airport by metro/tram. Mr. Isa and his staff were very friendly. Actually, He taught us how to play Backgammon!!! The inconvenient the we can report is that the room had twin beds and the emergency door was not well sealed. Fresh air (~0ÂºC) came into until we sealed it with toilet paper!! The breakfast, which was included, was correct and local.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view from the room, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: stefanie_kirchner
Reviews.Content: The view in the top rooms is just fantastic, You can watch the sunrise behind the blue mosque and see the mosque shiningit by night. ItÂ´s just a very crosy and charming hotel with very clean and very nice and luxery decorated rooms far away from any noise. Staff are extremeley attentive to detail, you always looked after and will be offer a cup of tea. Shurt distance to the blue mosque, hagha sophia and the grand bazar, just perfectly located. Good value for money, but most of all, it makes the Istanbul experience so inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Kind, helpful and with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: mattalaine
Reviews.Content: Staff: very kind and helpful. The room: little but very clean and with a great view to Blue Mosque, S.Sophia and sea! Location: central, more or less 200 meters from Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “very nice location and service”
Reviews.Author: annaborodavina
Reviews.Content: the location is just perfect for sightseeing, rooms a bit small, but very nice decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: maristelli
Reviews.Content: I've spent there the worst three day of my life: dirty, cold, unconfortable. We payed 20 euro per night more to have the view on the Blue Mosque but we were given a room on the opposite side. one day we even didn't had water in the toilette without notice. the room was very small and dirty and it was hard to open the door because of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: abrahamhalil
Reviews.Content: i stayed in SULTAN AHMET PARK HOTEL with my girl friend for a weekend leisure in December 2010.our superior room on the 5. floor had a great view of SULTAN AHMET MOSQUE ,HAGÄ°A SOPHÄ° AND BOSPHORES . The room was slightly small but it was tidy clean and very confortable.The staff were very kind and helpfull.they were always ready to help.the location is very good .All attractions are in the walking distance such as GRAND BAZAAR,BLUE MOSQUE,TOPKAPI PALACE AND HAGÄ°A SOPHÄ°A. Thank you guys for all.i will be there again for sure

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: waspie1
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the hotel was the friendliness and service provided by the staff. The rooms were slightly small but they were impeccably clean, had amazing views and the hotel is ideally located for the major tourist sites. The rates are also very reasonable. It would have been good to be offered a cooked breakfast as a paid for alternative but overall this hotel is ideal for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back soon again and again!!”
Reviews.Author: Bigdikran
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with 3 of my friends for 4 nights, we couldn't ask for more, excellent service, very comprehensive and helpful staff, big thanks for the manager mr. ISA , very clean rooms, and the best of all the location of the hotel, everything u want and anything is very close to the hotel, blue mosque and aya Sofia is less than 5 minutes walking, Sultanahmet downtown ( where all the pubs and food ) less than 1 min and the train exactly 30 seconds by feet! Can't ask for more!! Thank you SPH for the service, we'll be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Must be too fussy”
Reviews.Author: IanfromRAK
Reviews.Content: I must be getting too fussy or have stayed in too many good hotels as I couldn't really see whay this place is so highly rated. It's certainly got a great location and we paid extra for a room with a nice view, but the rooms are really small and the staff were pleasant enough without being anything too exceptional. No roof patio is a downside and the breakfast didn't compare with the Sari Konak where we stayed previously. The hotel has apparently been refurbished recently and we had intermittent power outages and no TV reception for most of our stay. I would look carefully at the alternatives as I sense there are better places for much the same price. I do applaud the free wi-fi though and the computer available in the lobby; a lesson to much more expensive hotels!

Reviews.Title: “FAntastic staff,fantastic view and an excellent starting point for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: darling7707
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel,especially the manager, couldn't do enough to keep us happy. We had a breathtaking view of the Marmara sea from our superior room on the sixth floor. Our room was very clean and the towels were really thick and luxurious. The hotel is ideal for sight seeing and is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the underground Cisterns, the Grand Basar and we even walked to the Galata Bridge and Tower and the 'Orient Express' railway station.If you don't wish to walk, the tram station is only round the corner. There are many very good and interesting bars and restaurants near the hotel. Thankyou Isa and your hotel team.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Staff; Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bklyn359
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sultanahmet Park were very helpful at all times. They were very attentive to our needs. Always checked up on us. The rooms were a little tight, but being that our time in the room was to sleep, it was ok with us. Sinan and the other staff made sure that our honeymoon experience in Istanbul was memorable. We felt really comfortable, conversed with all the staff, had ad hoc Turkish phrase lessons, got great suggestions for places to eat, and had an overall great time! We recommend the hotel - it's affordable, it's comfortable, it's centrally located, and again, it's all about how comfortable the staff makes you feel.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: cumali
Reviews.Content: An excellent reasonably-riced hotel,wÄ±th wellcoming ,friendly ,always helpfull staff.the hotel service was excellent and Ä± stayed at the room wÄ±th nice overview of the bosphorus the locatÄ±on.was very good.thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff, but rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: sgjd
Reviews.Content: We were at Sultanahmet Park for a weekend in October. The Hotel is very good located. The service is fine, very friendly reception. The breakfast is not more than average, the rooms far too small and were not perfectly cleaned; if you are at the 6th or 5th floor you can have a great view on the bosphorus. All in all good acceptable Hotel for a weekend stay,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - great location”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Park Hotel may be small, but it has great staff and a very central location. Walk down the road for a couple of minutes and you are in the Hippodrome opposite the Blue Mosque. Turn the opposite way and you are on Divanyolu Avenue, close to Cemberlitas and the Sultanahmet tram stop. An ideal location for exploring the historic centre. The hotel has only been open for six months, but Isa (the manager) and his team are great and the classic rooms are very clean and comfortable, if a little on the small side. However, most people don't visit Istanbul to look at the wallpaper in their room! Bed linen and towel were spotless. The bathrooms were quite small, but very functional and had plenty of hot water. There is a lift and only a couple of rooms on each floor, so it isn't a massive establishment and although it lacks amenities such as a gym or sauna, it does offer free hi-speed internet in the guest rooms. Breakfast was also very pleasant. While we were there the rear patio area was being enclosed to create a heated winter garden and this should be a very attractive feature for the spring, summer and autumn as most Istanbul hotels lack gardens, and have to create roof terraces instead. If you are looking for a very central location at a very reasonable price (discounts on four nights or more during our recent stay), plus very friendly staff who are happy to arrange taxis and other services, then we'd recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet Park Hotel is on the doorstep of the best of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: inmod
Reviews.Content: The Sultanahmet Park Hotel is perfectly located at the doorstep of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia and just two blocks from the tram and many restaurants in the Old City of Istanbul. The staff at the hotel is incredibly connected and accomodating -- ask for anything and they will do their best to make it happen. The hotel is small with only 14 rooms but they still have a computer with internet access in the lobby, wireless internet in the rooms, a nice breakfast buffet and a charming backyard patio. Don't expect spacious accommodations (the rooms and bathrooms are very small), room service or an exercise room -- this is a value hotel in a historic part of the city. You don't want to spend time in your room anyway with all of the fabulous things that Istanbul has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Marassa
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is ideally located in a relatively quiet side street in the heart of Sultanahmet, literally next door to main attractions. The buffet breakfasts served in a nice backyard were very good. Our room ("classic double") was absolutely tiny (the door kept scratching a bed on opening) and contained twin beds instead of one king size bed which we asked for but never got.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LenaIstanbul
Reviews.Content: My son (21 years old) and I stayed in this hotel for four nights. The staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for us. We were upgraded for two nights and had the most fantastic view over the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. The location is extremely useful for sightseeing in the old city, we walked everywhere however the tram stop is only a couple of minutes away. The rooms are very small but this wasn't a problem since we were out all the time. We could however have done with a small chair to hang the clothes on overnight. The bathrooms had recently been done up and were functional and clean. The only problem however was that there was nowhere to hang the towels but I understand that was going to be addressed in the next couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, great value for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KiwiToon
Reviews.Content: A small hotel that has just recently opened. Great location, a short walk from the tram and the main attractions in Sultanahmet. The staff we very helpful and friendly - nothing was a problem. The room was average size, nicely decorated, quiet air conditioning and reasonably soundproof. The garden area was nice and peaceful. No roof terrace at the moment. At the discounted rate this was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy small hotel, excellent service, breakfast in garden”
Reviews.Author: gijs44
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome by service-oriented personel. We made reservation for regular room but got the best room on the top floor with a view on the aya sophia and blue mosque for the same price! Breakfast in garden. Small room but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MYSS123
Reviews.Content: I had some problems with my online booking and after I called the Hotel from the US, the Manager Mr. Sinan Erdogan was very friendly and helpful. He assured me that everything was ok and he offered me a free pick up/drop off from/to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet content in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lainshaw
Reviews.Content: An excellent, reasonably-priced hotel, with welcoming, friendly, always helpful staff. It is in very easy reach of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia etc, and a main tram line, yet far enough down a side street to be able to get away from the hustle and bustle. The room was comfortable and very clean, and management and staff unfailing in their courteous, practical help. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Excelent Staffs”
Reviews.Author: Cushka
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel in September. The location is so good. It is near to all of the main sights. Everyday, we walked to Hagia Sufia and sultan ahmet mosque and Topkapi palace and it last just 5 min. It has a lovely little yard. The rooms were so clean and the most important thing was the hotel staffs. They were very kind and polite and so helpful. One of the most interesting things to me was the time of the breakfast. because we came to hotel very late at night and it was so tough to me to wake up early and take my breakfast;they kind of cooperate with us! I think they never close the breakfast time until they get sure that every one in hotel have their breakfast. beside of all, the price also was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a an excellent city”
Reviews.Author: DSL25
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was excellent and I stayed at a room with a nice overview of the Bosporus. This hotel is really near to all of the city's sightings. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality of hospitality and services”
Reviews.Author: Yilmaz-May
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Park Hotel is situated in a very nice province of Istanbul. Its proximity to the famous historical places makes the transportation easier. During our stay, the personnel were so friendly and wellcoming. My next stay in Istanbul will definitely be in Sultanahmet Park Hotel. Thanks for the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BavariaBound
Reviews.Content: We have just had 6 nights at this hotel in wonderful Sultanamet and would be hard pressed to fault it. Sinan and his staff were fabulous, we are not young and were somewhat nervous about visIting Istanbul, not knowing the language. How nice to walk into the hotel and be greeted with a smiling Sinan with wonderful English and such a helpful attitude towards the guests. Nothing was too much trouble, from recommending restaurants. getting us a cheap airport transfer to allowing us to use his printer to print our boarding passes. The staff were so obliging when our family visited and allowed them the use of the garden and coffee facilities. Another standout was the level of cleanlness, the rooms were spotless and we really appreciated the free WiFi. We walked to almost all the sights and/or caught the tram just up the street. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to even the most discerning traveller,

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, good located, helpful staff, must recomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: shahab79
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in Sultanahmet Park Hotel for twe and half weeks during wc basketball toernemnt. I've been charmed of good services from kind, helpfull and respectfull staf and professional management, clean rooms, confortable beds and good breakfast in the garden, WiFi high speed Internet, walking distance to beautiful places in Sultanahmet. I've recomended Sultanahmet Park Hotel to all my friends and now I want to share this with the people who likes to visite Istanbul. I really want to thanks the staff of this hotel, who makes my staying in Istanbul lot's of good memories.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel with very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: kiki515
Reviews.Content: I had defenetly a great time in this hotel. It was very clean and very nice to hang out. The terras was a good place to relax. And especially the staff was as helpfull, kind and gentle as you can get! I would surely recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location, Gr8 hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryano
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very close to the touristic center of Istanbul. It was in walking distance of Blue mosque. Also very close to the tramway station. The staff was very friendly and corporative. The rooms are not very big but very clean. Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: EMorris2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new (5 months) however it is a fantastic place to stay. Ideally located for all of the main places to visit (Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Sofia Haiga, Basillica Cistern, tram links etc). The staff are fantastic and cannot do enough for you, speaking excellent English (and i would assume other languages, it;s just the type of people they are). The rooms are compact with excellent air conditioning, brilliantly clean with extras such as fridge, slippers and hair dryers. Make no mistake the Sultanahmet Palace hotel is value for money with amazing staff and a chilled out atmosphere in a bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best experiences”
Reviews.Author: Ramett
Reviews.Content: Very good location, helpful and kind staff, nice view.. I really enjoyed staying there. and wish to come back soon again! I absoloutly recommend you to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: gillbee
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great trip to Istanbul made even better by the great staff at the Sultanahmet park hotel. The hotel location is great with many major sights and the main tram line within a short walk - ideal for our 1st visit to the city. The rooms are compact with everything we needed - comfy beds, air con, tv and were always spotlessly cleaned. There is a courtyard out back where we ate our buffet breakfast (tasty fresh veg, meat, bread, fruit, cheese etc) every morning and spent a couple evenings for relaxing with a beer and a deck of cards. Staff couldn't have been nicer and helped us with so much - travel arrangements for a concert outside of the city ( phoning the stadium and checking the times of the last buses and trains for us), maps / directions checking local turkish baths prices and times, speaking to our aiport collection taxi when they got lost, good local kebab recomendations.....the list goes on. Nothing was ever too much hassle and I have to thank the staff for making everything so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet service before i even get there”
Reviews.Author: Veruschia
Reviews.Content: I want to express my thanks about the experience i have had so far with Sinan the manager. He has been very accomodating with regards to price (during Eid) a huge muslim festival in turkey, and accomodating all my needs including free airport transfers. So far my experience has been good - once i have stayed at the hotel, i will review it again - and give my honest opinions. But already the hotel is precedented by this wonderful service. I hope to see how good the hotel is?

HotelInfo.Name: Sultanahmet Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek mah. Klodfarer Cad. | No:19 Sultanahmet / Fatih, Istanbul 34200, Turkey
